alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Putnam (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Putnam and west central Hancock Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 644 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Plant Harlee Branch, or 9 miles north of Milledgeville, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Oconee Springs Park and Plant Harlee Branch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
